page.title: 16FARMING IN THE WINTER
page.content: A typical farmer would get up around 7 o'clock a.m. in the winter; maybe later if he has had a cow calving during the night which often happens at this time of the year.The first thing he does is to feed the cows (which are in the barn) with oats then either hay or silage. Then depending on whether or not the cows are in a slatted byre (where the muck drains through on its own) he might have to clean out. This can be a long job which has to be done twice a day. The farmer has to get up two or three times a night to check that there are no cows calving.
